org.pac4j.core.client

Class BaseClient<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pac4j.core.util.InitializableObject
      • org.pac4j.core.client.BaseClient<C,U>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Client<C,U>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseHttpClient, BaseOAuthClient, BaseOpenIdClient, CasClient, CasProxyReceptor, GaeUserServiceClient, Saml2Client

    public abstract class BaseClient<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>
extends InitializableObject
implements Client<C,U>, Cloneable
    This class is the default implementation of a client (whatever the protocol). It has the core concepts :
    • the initialization process is handled by the InitializableObject inheritance, the InitializableObject.internalInit() must be implemented in sub-classes
    • the cloning process is handled by the clone() method, the newClient() method must be implemented in sub-classes to create a new instance
    • the callback url is handled through the setCallbackUrl(String) and getCallbackUrl() methods
    • the name of the client is handled through the setName(String) and getName() methods
    • the concept of "direct" redirection is defined through the isDirectRedirection() method : if true, the redirect(WebContext, boolean, boolean) method will always return the redirection to the provider where as if it's false, the redirection url will be the callback url with an additionnal parameter : NEEDS_CLIENT_REDIRECTION_PARAMETER to require the redirection, which will be handled later in the getCredentials(WebContext) method.
      To force a direct redirection, the getRedirectAction(WebContext, boolean, boolean) must be used with true for the forceDirectRedirection parameter
    • if you enable "contextual redirects" by using the setEnableContextualRedirects(boolean), you can use relative callback urls which will be completed according to the current host, port and scheme. Disabled by default.

    The InitializableObject.init() method must be called implicitly by the main methods of the Client interface, so that no explicit call is required to initialize the client.

    The getMechanism() method returns the implemented Mechanism by the client.

    After retrieving the user profile, the client can generate the authorization information (roles, permissions and remember-me) by using the appropriate AuthorizationGenerator, which is by default null.

    Since:
    1.4.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu

      • redirect

        public final void redirect(WebContext context,
            boolean protectedTarget,
            boolean ajaxRequest)
                    throws RequiresHttpAction
        Description copied from interface: Client
        Redirect to the authentication provider by updating the WebContext accordingly.

        Though, if this client requires an indirect redirection, it will return a redirection to the callback url (with an additionnal parameter requesting a redirection). Whatever the kind of client's redirection, the protectedTarget parameter set to true enforces a direct redirection.

        If an authentication has already been tried for this client and has failed (previous null credentials) and if the target is protected (protectedTarget set to true), a forbidden response (403 HTTP status code) is returned.

        If the request is an AJAX one (ajaxRequest parameter set to true), an authorized response (401 HTTP status code) is returned instead of a redirection.

        Specified by:
        redirect in interface Client<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>
        Throws:
        RequiresHttpAction

      • getRedirectAction

        public final RedirectAction getRedirectAction(WebContext context,
                               boolean protectedTarget,
                               boolean ajaxRequest)
                                       throws RequiresHttpAction
        Get the redirectAction computed for this client. All the logic is encapsulated here. It should not be called be directly, the redirect(WebContext, boolean, boolean) should be generally called instead.
        Parameters:
        context -
        protectedTarget -
        ajaxRequest -
        Returns:
        the redirection action
        Throws:
        RequiresHttpAction

      • getCredentials

        public final C getCredentials(WebContext context)
                                           throws RequiresHttpAction
        Description copied from interface: Client
        Get the credentials from the web context. In some cases, a RequiresHttpAction may be thrown instead:
        • if this client requires an indirect redirection, the redirection will be actually performed by these method and not by the Client.redirect(WebContext, boolean, boolean) one (302 HTTP status code)
        • if the CasClient receives a logout request, it returns a 200 HTTP status code
        • for the BasicAuthClient, if no credentials are sent to the callback url, an unauthorized response (401 HTTP status code) is returned to request credentials through a popup.
        Specified by:
        getCredentials in interface Client<C extends Credentials,U extends CommonProfile>
        Returns:
        the credentials
        Throws:
        RequiresHttpAction
